byline.contributor: Adam Liptak and Anita Gates contributed reporting.
byline.original: By RICHARD SEVERO and WILLIAM McDONALD

abstract: Jack Greenberg, lawyer chosen by Thurgood Marshall to join civil rights legal team in historic 1954 Supreme Court decision Brown v Board of Education, dies at age 91; Greenberg would also represent Martin Luther King Jr and lead other high-profile civil rights cases throughout his career.

headline.print_headline: Jack Greenberg, Last Survivor of Legal Team Famed for Its Civil Rights Efforts, Dies at 91
headline.main: Jack Greenberg, a Courthouse Pillar of the Civil Rights Movement, Dies at 91

keywords.value: NAACP Legal Defense and Educational Fund
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: Brown v Board of Education (Supreme Court Decision)
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Mr. Greenberg, a member of a legal team assembled by Thurgood Marshall, was involved in more than 40 civil rights cases before the Supreme Court....
lead_paragraph: Mr. Greenberg, a member of a legal team assembled by Thurgood Marshall, was involved in more than 40 civil rights cases before the Supreme Court.
